title: 105_hr120
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997". Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include changes such as adding "family farms or" in paragraph (51B) and inserting "The term" before each paragraph designation. Additionally, adjustments are made in paragraphs (35)(B), (35A), (38), and (54) by modifying certain phrases and punctuation. In section 101 of title 11, United States Code, amendments include renumbering paragraphs and changing punctuation. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT OF DOLLAR AMOUNTS. Amends Section 104 of title 11, United States Code by inserting ``522(f)(3),'' after ``522(d),'' each place it appears. 

SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF TIME. Amends Section 108(c)(2) of title 11, United States Code by striking ``922'' and all that follows through ``or'', and inserting ``922, 1201, or''. 

SEC. 5. PENALTY FOR PERSONS WHO NEGLIGENTLY OR FRAUDULENTLY PREPARE BANKRUPTCY PETITIONS. Amends Section 110(j)(3) of title 11, United States Code by striking ``attorney's'' and inserting ``attorneys' ''. 

SEC. 6. ELIGIBILITY TO SERVE AS TRUSTEE. SEC. 6. ELIGIBILITY TO SERVE AS TRUSTEE. Amends section 321(a) of title 11, United States Code by removing references to certain sections. SEC. 7. EMPLOYMENT OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Section 327 of title 11, United States Code is amended to update the authority of the Trustee, including changes to subsections (b), (c), and (d). Additionally, section 328(b) is amended to limit compensation by removing the ability to serve as an attorney or accountant. Section 327 of title 11, United States Code is amended to update the authority of the Trustee, including changes to subsections (b), (c), and (d). The amendment removes the ability to serve as an attorney or accountant and replaces it with the ability to render professional services. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON COMPENSATION OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Amends Section 328(a) of title 11, United States Code to include compensation on a fixed or percentage fee basis.

SEC. 7. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. Amends Section 330(a) of title 11, United States Code regarding compensation to officers and the debtor's attorney.

SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Amends Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code by striking certain language.

SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. Amends Section 348(f)(2) of title 11, United States Code by inserting "of the estate" after "property". Section 365 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions regarding the satisfaction of penalty rates in contracts and leases, as well as nonmonetary obligations under executory contracts or leases. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions regarding the satisfaction of penalty rates in contracts and leases, as well as nonmonetary obligations under executory contracts or leases. Amendments include changes to subsections (c), (d), and (f)(1) by adjusting paragraphs and inserting periods. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS.

Amends the item for section 556 to include a contractual right to liquidate commodities or forward contracts.

SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES.

Amends section 503(b)(4) of title 11, inserting references to specific subparagraphs before paragraph (3).

SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. Section 507(a) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to adjust certain paragraphs. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. Section 522 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to clarify liabilities and support. Subsection (g)(2) is also updated. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include new provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor. Amendments include changes to subsections (a)(17) and (e) regarding court orders on prisoners and insured individuals. SEC. 17 amends Section 524(a)(3) of title 11, US Code, regarding discharge effects. SEC. 18 modifies Section 525(c) concerning protection against discriminatory treatment. SEC. 19 addresses property of the estate. SEC. 19 amends Section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) of title 11, US Code by inserting "365 or" before "542". SEC. 20 redesignates subsection (g) as subsection (h) in Section 546. SEC. 21 deals with the liability of a transferee of an avoided transfer. Section 550(c) of title 11, United States Code is amended to clarify the recovery process for transfers that are avoidable under section 547. Transfers made for the benefit of a non-insider transferee can be avoided under section 547, or recovered from a transferee who was not an insider at the time of the transfer. Section 550(c) of title 11, United States Code is amended to clarify the recovery process for transfers that are avoidable under section 547. The amendment allows for the recovery of transfers made to a non-insider transferee. SEC. 22. SETOFF. Amends section 553(b)(1) of title 11, United States Code by changing "362(b)(14)" to "362(b)(17)." SEC. 23. DISPOSITION OF PROPERTY OF THE ESTATE. Amends section 726(b) of title 11, United States Code by removing "1009,". SEC. 24. GENERAL PROVISIONS. Amends section 901(a) of title 11, United States Code by adding "1123(d)," after "1123(b),". SEC. 25. APPOINTMENT OF ELECTED TRUSTEE. Section 1104(b) of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions for the election of an eligible, disinterested trustee at a meeting of creditors. The United States trustee must file a report certifying the election, after which the elected trustee is considered selected and appointed, and the service of any previously appointed trustee terminates. The court will resolve any disputes arising from an election under subsection (d). SEC. 26 to SEC. 29 of title 11, United States Code, are amended regarding railroad line abandonment, plan contents, payments, and discharge. SEC. 29 amends section 1228 of title 11 by changing references from "1222(b)(10)" to "1222(b)(9". SEC. 30 modifies section 1322 by adjusting subsections (b) and (e). SEC. 31 addresses discharge in bankruptcy proceedings. SEC. 31 amends section 1328(a) of title 11, US Code, regarding discharge in bankruptcy cases. It specifies types of debts that are not discharged, including those under section 1322(b)(5), specified in section 523(a)(5), (8), or (9), and for restitution or criminal fines. SEC. 32 amends Section 1334(d) of title 28, US Code, regarding bankruptcy cases and proceedings. It clarifies changes made under subsection (c). SEC. 33 amends Section 604 of the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1994 by redesignating subsections. SEC. 34 addresses knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 34 amends Section 156(a) of title 18, US Code by defining terms related to bankruptcy law and rules. SEC. 35 states that the Act and its amendments will take effect on the enactment date, with the amendments applying to cases under title 11 of the United States Code initiated after the enactment date.
